titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Pittsburgh Symphony Society Records, 1927-1964 AIS.1966.16
titlestmt.author: Wendy Pflug

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-08 17:13:33 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Pittsburgh Symphony Society was formed in 1927 to support the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra. This collection consists of organizational records, committee activities, contracts, active and inactive Society membership cards, brochures, advertisements, financial records and ledgers, scrapbooks, and newspaper clippings.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Pittsburgh Symphony Society emanated from the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra to support, encourage, and promote further interest in the arts. The Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra was originally formed in 1895 and disbanded due to financial difficulties in 1910. It was 1926 before the orchestra was reestablished with its members rehearsing for no fee and each musician contributed money to make a new season in 1927 possible. The Pittsburgh Symphony Society was formed in 1927 to administer the daily tasks associated with running a symphony. The Society raised funds in order to maintain an orchestra by actively soliciting corporate and individual members, running the box office, and careful accounting. The Society was also responsible for arranging contracts between musicians and conductors, along with program advertisers. The Pittsburgh Symphony Society sought to raise the profile of the symphony promoting performances in local publications, through advertisements and announcements. In order to instill a life-long appreciation of music, the Society organized frequent Young People's Concerts for local school children. The Pittsburgh Symphony Society's primary goal was to promote and financially support the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra. It achieved world wide renown and recognition, often appearing in national and international publications to great acclaim.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains financial records, organization records, contracts, operational material on the Pittsburgh Symphony and active and inactive Society membership cards, financial campaign material, scrapbooks of newspaper clippings, committee activities, advertisements, and memorabilia.

odd.p: Pittsburgh Symphony Society Records, 1927-1964, AIS.1966.16, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was reprocessed by Wendy Pflug in September 2009. It was originally processed by Archive Service Center staff in 1966.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Administrative Files series contains information on the daily administration of the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra by the Pittsburgh Symphony Society. Included in this series are documents on organizing special concerts for local school children, contracts with various musicians, along with programs, orchestra tour schedules, and tickets. Also included in this series is correspondence and notes from the Board of Directors, President, Vice President, Secretary, and Manager of the Pittsburgh Symphony Society. This Administrative Files series is arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Press Files series contains material that publicized performances of the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra. Included in this series are numerous newspaper clippings from local and national publications that show the popularity and renown of the symphony. The Press Files series also feature advertisement and announcements of symphony concerts. Of particular interest are a brief biography written by the Society on renowned conductor Fritz Reiner and press releases from Columbia Music on recording released of Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra performances. This series is arranged by year.

did.unittitle: Newspaper Clippings on Symphony Guest Artists
Fritz Reiner Biography and Newspaper Clippings
Press Releases for the Performance of Handel's Messiah

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series chronicles the financial accounting of maintaining the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra. The Financial Files series includes information on various fundraising campaigns, contributions pledged, box office statements, and expenditure reports. This series also includes twelve oversized financial ledgers detailing cash receipts, disbursements, accounts, and payroll. The Financial Files series is arranged by year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Membership Files series details the various membership campaigns and drives lead by the Pittsburgh Symphony Society. Included in this series are index cards of season subscribers and correspondence with corporate sponsors, events planned and coordinated by the Pittsburgh Symphony Society Womem's Association. This series is arranged by year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series features nine oversized scrapbooks of Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra performances and Pittsburgh Symphony Society activities. The scrapbooks are largely comprised of newspaper clippings and are arranged by date. The scrapbooks chronicling the activities of the Pittsburgh Symphony Society consist of form letter sent to member and memorabilia such as ticket stubs and pledge forms. The Scrapbook series is arranged by year.
